statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: MISSOURI VALLEY CONF TR AT ST LOUIS MO

article.description: Lawrence Wright scored 18 points and grabbed seven rebounds as No. 5 seed Bradley upset No. 4 seed Creighton 54-47 Friday in the Missouri Valley Conference Tournament quarterfinals.
article.headline: No. 5 seed Bradley upsets No. 4 seed Creighton
article.linkText: No. 5 seed Bradley upsets No. 4 seed Creighton
article.story: ST. LOUIS (AP) -- Lawrence Wright scored 18 points and grabbed seven rebounds as No. 5 seed Bradley upset No. 4 seed Creighton 54-47 Friday in the Missouri Valley Conference Tournament quarterfinals. Bradley (19-9) has won six in a row and 10 of its last 12. The six game winning streak is the longest for the Braves since the 2000-01 season. The Braves will play No. 1 seed Wichita State Saturday. Earlier Friday, the Shockers knocked off Indiana State 81-63. Tony Bennett added 16 points, five rebounds and five assists to Bradley's cause. Creighton (19-9), which had won four of the last six Missouri Valley Conference Tournaments, will now have to hope for an at-large bid in the NCAA Tournament. The Blue Jays were led by Anthony Tolliver, who scored 16 points. Last year's Missouri Valley Conference Tournament Most Outstanding Player Johnny Mathies had 10 points, but was just 2-of-13 from the field. It looked like Creighton would advance early in the second half, as the Blue Jays scored six straight to take a 29-21 lead. But Bradley went on an 8-0 run to tie the game, which was capped by Bennett's 3-pointer. Bradley was clinging to a 45-44 lead when Wright hit two free throws to make it 47-44 with 1:31 left. After Creighton failed to score, Marcellus Sommerville buried a 3-pointer with 1:00 on the clock to give Bradley a 50-44 advantage. Creighton never got closer than five after that.
